page.title: 18Church Buildings
page.content: St. Peters Church, Thurleigh, forms the focal point of the village buildings. The central tower was built in early 12th century. The southern doorway has a tympanum depicting Eve tempting Adam. In 1970, as a necessary repair, the aisle battlements and clerestory were removed, a new nave roof has been constructed, altering the external proportions of the church from it's Mediaeval appearance. The Bolnhurst village church of St. Dunstan stands in an isolated position. The village that was around the church depopulated at the time of the Black Death in 14th century and was never reinhabited. The church is 100yds. back from the road surrounded by trees, on the edge of the valley overlooking the brook, By the south entrance the stump of the church cross stands. Inside is simple and lovely.
